thread.title: 5-year-old learns to write first word thanks to Gwen Stefani's 'Hollaback Girl'
thread.title_full: 5-year-old learns to write first word thanks to Gwen Stefani's 'Hollaback Girl'

author: Chloe Bryan
title: 5-year-old learns to write first word thanks to Gwen Stefani's 'Hollaback Girl'
text:
This kid's spelling skills are bananas. B-A-N-A-N-A-S.
New Yorker and Gwen Stefani mega-fan Norah shared a video Thursday of her 5-year-old son, Max, writing his first word: "bananas."
And as he writes each letter, it's clear where he got the word from: Stefani's catchy-to-a-fault 2004 song "Hollaback Girl."
SEE ALSO: Extremely grateful kid is excited to receive toilet paper for Christmas
When you realize @gwenstefani taught your 5 year old how to write his first word üòçüòçüòçüòÇ üçåüçå pic.twitter.com/T0CMCIWaMa
‚Äî Norah (@Nyc1Jones) January 5, 2017
"This year, because of Gwen's tour, I played even more music and he got really into it," Norah told Mashable. "'Hollaback Girl' is by far his favorite song." (A great choice, Max.)
"Max started kindergarten this year and he's learning to read and write," she continued. "We practice his writing every night and one day he just started writing 'bananas' all by himself and when I asked how he knew that he said it was just like in 'Hollaback Girl.'"
We are sure Ms. Stefani is proud.
